page.title: 07NEW ABBEY - FARMING
page.content: Farmland is of a very high quality being low-lying and sheltered. Farms are usually between 100 and 200 acres in size. Some are tenanted while others are farmed by their owners. Most of the farms have dairy herds of 80-100 cows, nearly all Friesians. Only two farms still use byres.Others keep the cows in loose-housing and milk them in parlours of the "herring- bone" type. Grass is grown in most of the fields and made into silage. Some farms grow small acreages of barley but few root crops. Some bullocks are fattened, either Hereford cross or crossed with a Continental breed such as Simmental, Limousin or Charolais. A few farms keep sheep, mostly Blackfaces or Greyfaces,but not many hens or pigs are kept.
